#Text=Tateyama Kurobe Alpine Route
#Text=The Tateyama Kurobe Alpine Route ( 立山黒部アルペンルート Tateyama Kurobe Arupen Rūto ) is a sightseeing route between Tateyama , Toyama and Ōmachi , Nagano , Japan .

column3: 立山黒部アルペンルート

column1: #Text=Understand
#Text=In order to build the Kurobe Dam , opened in 1963 and at 186 meters still the tallest in Japan , a tunnel 5.4 km long was dug under Mount Tate ( Tateyama ) .

#Text=Sensing an opportunity , the Tateyama Kurobe Kankō ( TKK ) company was set up to turn this into a tourist attraction , stringing together a series of cable cars , aerial lifts and buses into a 37-km path across and through the mountains .
#Text=Climate
#Text=Due to the high altitude ( over 2,400m at Murodō ) , it 's cold up top : April lows are below freezing and even in midsummer you 'll be lucky if the mercury cracks 15°C .
#Text=It 's also just high enough to potentially trigger altitude sickness , although this is unlikely to manifest as anything more severe than a headache and feeling out of breath easily .
#Text=Get in
#Text=The main cities near the termini are Toyama to the west and Matsumoto to the east .
#Text=By train , Toyama can be reached from Tokyo in about two hours on the Hokuriku Shinkansen , while Matsumoto is about 2.5 hours from Tokyo on the Super Azusa express .
#Text=From Osaka , Toyama can be reached on the direct Thunderbird express ( 3.5 hours ) , while Matsumoto can be reached after changing trains in Nagoya ( total 4 hours ) .
#Text=Driving across the Alpine Route is not permitted .
#Text=Tateyama Traffic can deliver your car to the other end , but they have to do it the long way around ( ~200 km ) and this costs a stiff ¥ 26,000 .
#Text=Get around
#Text=As private transportation is neither permitted nor possible , the only ways to cross from Tateyama to Ōgisawa are the official TKK route , or a lengthy and demanding multi-day trek .
#Text=Open from mid-April to November ( the exact dates vary yearly based on snow conditions ) , the official route consists of :
#Text=All modes of transport run every 20-40 minutes , roughly from 7 AM to 5 PM .
#Text=However , at peak times , notably the April-May snow season and in particular during the Golden Week holidays ( April 29-May 5 ) , waiting times of over an hour are not uncommon .
#Text=Tickets are sold based on the number of stages traveled , and once purchased are valid for up to five days .
#Text=As an indication , Toyama to Murodō is ¥ 3,630 one-way , while the full whack from Toyama to Shinano-Omachi is a steep ¥ 9,140 one-way .

#Text=Due to the amount of walking involved and the number of transfers , carting about heavy bags is not recommended , but fortunately all accommodations on route will be happy to arrange next-day takkyubin pick up and delivery at around ¥ 2000 to/from Tokyo/Osaka for a suitcase under 25 kg .
#Text=See
#Text=Yuki no Ōtani ( 雪の大谷 ) , Murodo .
#Text=The " Valley of Snow " is arguably the Alpine Route 's top sight : a bus route carved into a veritable mountain of compacted snow , reaching up to 14 meters at its highest point .
#Text=It 's in full form from April to late May , and melts away during the summer .
#Text=Kurobe Dam ( 黒部ダム ) .
#Text=The route 's raison d'être , and still an awe-inspiring sight .
#Text=Behind the dam lies Kurobe-ko ( 黒部湖 ) , the lake it created .
#Text=Do
#Text=There are plenty of hiking opportunities in the summer and fall , including an ascent of Mount Tate itself .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=There are several hotels along the route itself , but these are all 1970s-era concrete behemoths and they 're pricy due to the complicated logistics needed to supply them .
#Text=Most visitors opt to day-trip or stay in the towns at either end .
#Text=Hotel Keisui , Oomachi Onsen-kyo , Oomachi-shi , Nagano-ken , 398-0001 , ☏ +81-261-22-5501 , fax : +81-261-22-5418 .
#Text=Check-in : 15:00 , check-out : 10:00 .
#Text=Located at the entrance of Tateyama Kurobe Alpen Route .
#Text=Go next
#Text=Mount Tate
